message:
When CancellationToken option exists for specific method, does it guarantee that method will break from "IsCancellationRequested" in all cases or it is checked in some points and for the rest the calling method has to organize timeout? Something like: try to cancel if possible and terminate after timeout.

One additional question: If a program (console application) has to do parallel job all time until running (e.g. checking something in the background), can this be done with async Task method called without "await" or is better to create thread?
